CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We recognize that both J sc and FF of PIDT-C12NT based device were much higher than those of obtained based on the other two polymers , which could be ascribed to optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer and superior charge carrier mobility that can promote the exciton separation and charge transporting , and consequently lead to simultaneously increased J sc and FF. The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges. It is also worth pointing out that the accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light. The EQE spectra are shown in Figure 6b. The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18 , 7.83 , and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT respectively , which show mismatches with that of determined from current density measurement of three devices in the range of 3-5 % . One can clearly observe the distinctly improved EQE values of polymers by switching the thiophene spacer from the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain ( PIDT - EHNT ) to linear hexyl side chain ( PIDT - DTNT ) , which was further improved for the bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain attached on the optimized position ( PIDT-C12NT ) . In conclusion , three donor - acceptor type low band gap conjugated polymers based on indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) with differ - ent thiophene spacers were synthesized by Stille copolymerization. All polymers showed relatively deep HOMO levels that consequently lead to high open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices. It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PIDT-C12NT: This is mentioned several times in the paragraph as the name of the material.
2. PIDT-EHNT: This is mentioned as a material name in the paragraph, indicating that it is another material with a similar structure to PIDT-C12NT but with a different spacer.
3. PIDT-DTNT: This is also mentioned as a material name in the paragraph, indicating that it is another material with a similar structure to PIDT-C12NT but with a different spacer.
4. PC71BM: This is mentioned as a material used in the solar cell devices, indicating that it is a separate material from the ones mentioned earlier.

So, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PIDT-C12NT
2. PIDT-EHNT
3. PIDT-DTNT
4. PC71BM
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. PIDT-C12NT
2. PIDT-DTNT

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PIDT-DTNT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We recognize that both J sc and FF of PIDT-C12NT based device were much higher than those of obtained based on the other two polymers , which could be ascribed to optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer and superior charge carrier mobility that can promote the exciton separation and charge transporting , and consequently lead to simultaneously increased J sc and FF. The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges. It is also worth pointing out that the accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light. The EQE spectra are shown in Figure 6b. The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18 , 7.83 , and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT respectively , which show mismatches with that of determined from current density measurement of three devices in the range of 3-5 % . One can clearly observe the distinctly improved EQE values of polymers by switching the thiophene spacer from the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain ( PIDT - EHNT ) to linear hexyl side chain ( PIDT - DTNT ) , which was further improved for the bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain attached on the optimized position ( PIDT-C12NT ) . In conclusion , three donor - acceptor type low band gap conjugated polymers based on indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) with differ - ent thiophene spacers were synthesized by Stille copolymerization. All polymers showed relatively deep HOMO levels that consequently lead to high open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices. It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the property names of the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PIDT-C12NT: Polymer name
2. IDT: Indacenodithiophene
3. NT: Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole)
4. PC71BM: Polymeric organic photovoltaic material (specifically, a blend of poly[7,10-phenylene vinylene] and [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester)
5. HOMO: Highest occupied molecular orbital level
6. LUMO: Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital level
7. EQE: External quantum efficiency
8. Jsc: Short-circuit current density
9. FF: Fill factor

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to property names of materials:

1. PIDT-C12NT: Polymer name
2. IDT: Indacenodithiophene
3. NT: Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities from the paragraph that refer to property names of materials, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| IDT |
| NT |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We recognize that both J sc and FF of PIDT-C12NT based device were much higher than those of obtained based on the other two polymers , which could be ascribed to optimal morphology with appropriate domain size of the photoactive layer and superior charge carrier mobility that can promote the exciton separation and charge transporting , and consequently lead to simultaneously increased J sc and FF. The increased J sc of PIDT-C12NT may be also attributed to the enhanced film absorption coefficient so that more sunlight can be absorbed and then generate more excitons , finally produce more charges. It is also worth pointing out that the accuracy of the J sc results was further confirmed by external quantum efficiency ( EQEs ) measurement under illumination of monochromatic light. The EQE spectra are shown in Figure 6b. The calculated current density from the EQE measurement were 4.18 , 7.83 , and 9.72 mA cm^-2 for PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT respectively , which show mismatches with that of determined from current density measurement of three devices in the range of 3-5 % . One can clearly observe the distinctly improved EQE values of polymers by switching the thiophene spacer from the branched 2-ethylhexyl side chain ( PIDT - EHNT ) to linear hexyl side chain ( PIDT - DTNT ) , which was further improved for the bithiophene spacer with linear dodecyl side chain attached on the optimized position ( PIDT-C12NT ) . In conclusion , three donor - acceptor type low band gap conjugated polymers based on indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) with differ - ent thiophene spacers were synthesized by Stille copolymerization. All polymers showed relatively deep HOMO levels that consequently lead to high open circuit voltage of the solar cell devices. It was shown that the improvement of the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and optimal morphology of bulk heterojunction film blended with PC71BM can be achieved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Morphology: Not explicitly mentioned.
2. Domain size of the photoactive layer: Not explicitly mentioned.
3. Charge carrier mobility: Not explicitly mentioned.
4. Absorption coefficient: 4.18 m^(-1), 7.83 m^(-1), and 9.72 m^(-1) for PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT, respectively.
5. Open circuit voltage (Voc): Not explicitly mentioned.
6. HOMO levels: Relatively deep HOMO levels were observed for all polymers.
7. Processability: Improved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units.
8. Backbone planarity: Improved by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units.
9. External quantum efficiency (EQE): 4.18%, 7.83%, and 9.72% for PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT, respectively.

Note that some of these values are mentioned in the paragraph, while others are calculated or inferred from the information provided.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

1. 4.18 m^(-1)
2. 7.83 m^(-1)
3. 9.72 m^(-1)

These are the values of the absorption coefficient for the three different polymers mentioned in the paragraph.
